# Code

## Import

```jsx
import { Code } from 'bumbag'
```

## Usage

```jsx-live
<Code>Hello world!</Code>
```

### Code blocks

A code block can be rendered by setting the `isBlock` prop. This will wrap the code in a `<pre>`.

```jsx-live
<Code isBlock>
{`function log(message) {
  console.log(message);
}`}
</Code>
```

### Colors

You can style code with colors from the palette.

```jsx-live
<Code palette="primary">Hello world</Code><br/>
<Code palette="secondary">Hello world</Code><br/>
<Code palette="success">Hello world</Code>
```

## Code Props

<!-- Automatically generated -->

**<Code fontSize="150" marginRight="major-1">isBlock</Code>** <Code fontSize="100" palette="primary">boolean</Code> 

Indicates if the code should be placed in a block.

<Divider marginTop="major-2" marginBottom="major-2" />

**<Code fontSize="150" marginRight="major-1">palette</Code>**  

<Code isBlock palette="primary" fontSize="150" padding="minor-1" marginBottom="major-2">
{`"default"
  | "primary"
  | "secondary"
  | "success"
  | "danger"
  | "warning"
  | (string & {})`}
</Code>

Color of the code (inline) block.

## Theming

<Theme component={'Code'} overrides={['Code.styles.base', {key: 'Code.styles.block', props: { isBlock: true }}]}>Hello world</Theme>
